commitResults.messageTitle: Level 0. Rename, Greet, Exit (a) Give your chatbot a new name, to differentiate it from the placeholder name Duke.
commitResults.messageBody: (b) Implement an initial skeletal version of the it that simply greets the user and exits.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 1. Echo Improve the skeletal version of Duke so that it echos commands entered by the user, and exits when the user types the command bye.
Level 2. Add, List Add the ability to store whatever text entered by the user and display them back to the user when requested.
Level 3. Mark as Done Add the ability to mark tasks as done. Optionally, add the ability to change the status back to not done.
Level 4. ToDos, Events, Deadlines Add support for tracking three types of tasks:
commitResults.messageBody:
ToDos: tasks without any date/time attached to it e.g., visit new theme park
Deadlines: tasks that need to be done before a specific date/time e.g., submit report by 11/10/2019 5pm
Events: tasks that start at a specific date/time and ends at a specific date/time
e.g., (a) team project meeting 2/10/2019 2-4pm (b) orientation week 4/10/2019 to 11/10/2019

Added support for all the tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Use the input/output redirection technique to semi-automate the testing of Duke.
Level 5. Handle Errors Teach the chatbot to deal with errors such as incorrect inputs entered by the user.
Level 6. Delete Add support for deleting tasks from the list.

Level-7: Implement automatic task data saving and loading from disk This commit introduces the feature of automatically saving tasks to the hard disk whenever the task list undergoes changes. Additionally, it enables the loading of task data from the hard disk during the chatbot's startup. The file name and relative path are hard-coded from the project root. The data is stored in a format designed for efficient storage and retrieval. This feature enhances the user experience by ensuring that task data persists across chatbot sessions and remains consistent even in the event of interruptions.
Level-8: Dates and Times This commit implements date and time understanding for tasks.
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit enhances the chatbot's capability to intelligently interpret dates and times provided in commands. When processing task inputs like "deadline return book /by 2/12/2019 1800", the chatbot now comprehends the date "2/12/2019" as 2nd of December 2019 and the time "1800" as 6pm. The parsed dates are stored as java.time.LocalDate or java.time.LocalDateTime objects in task instances.

Additionally, the chatbot accepts dates in the yyyy-mm-dd format (e.g., 2019-10-15) and presents them in a more readable format such as MMM dd yyyy (e.g., Oct 15 2019) when displaying task details. This improvement elevates the user experience by enabling more natural and intuitive interaction with date and time information.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-MoreOOP: Rewrote brotherman chatbot in OOP style.  Added new classes to encapsulate commands as well as Ui, Storage and TaskList.

commitResults.messageBody: Merge MoreOOP.  OOP the files.  Created new classes to encapsulate commands, parsing, ui and storage.
Added packages into Brotherman.  Added Commands, exceptions, parser, storage, tasks, ui.
Added packages into Brotherman.  Added Commands, exceptions, parser, storage, tasks, ui.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests for Parser class and Ui class.
commitResults.messageBody:
Sure, I can help you write a GitHub commit message where JUnit tests have been added to test the code. Here is an example of a commit message:

Add JUnit tests for Parser class

This commit adds JUnit tests for the parseTodo() and ShowWelcomeMessage()

This commit adds Javadocs to all files in the project. Javadocs are documentation comments that can be used to describe the purpose of a class, method, or field. They can be helpful for understanding the code and for debugging.

This commit adds the FindCommand class, which allows users to find tasks with a specified keyword.

The FindCommand class is a subclass of the Command class. It has a constructor that takes the keyword as a parameter. The execute() method of the FindCommand class calls the getTasksByKeyword() method of the TaskList class to get the tasks that match the keyword. The showTaskList() method of the Ui class is then called to display the list of tasks to the user.

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/brotherman/tasks/TaskList.java
#	src/main/java/brotherman/ui/Ui.java

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Checkstyle to project and resolve all Checkstyle issues
commitResults.messageBody:
In this commit, we introduce Checkstyle to our project to enforce consistent coding style and maintain code quality. The following changes have been made:

- Added Checkstyle plugin to IntelliJ IDEA for integrated code analysis.
- Configured Checkstyle with a custom checkstyle.xml configuration file tailored to our project's coding standards.
- Resolved all Checkstyle issues identified in the codebase, ensuring adherence to the coding guidelines.

This implementation helps us maintain a cleaner and more consistent codebase, making it easier to collaborate and maintain the project in the long run.

commitResults.messageTitle: Resolve Parsing and general Code Cleanup
commitResults.messageBody:
- Improved parsing logic for date and time strings to handle a wider range of formats.

- Conducted a thorough code review and performed extensive code cleanup.
   - Removed redundant code, optimized data structures, and enhanced code readability.
   - Applied consistent coding standards and naming conventions across the project.

Implemented a basic graphical user interface (GUI) using JavaFX. This GUI includes a main window with a scrollable chat container, a user input field, and a send button. The GUI provides the foundation for future user interaction and chatbot functionality.  Logic for chatbot not yet done.

commitResults.messageTitle: Enhance GUI using JavaFX and maintain chatbot functionality In this commit, I have improved the graphical user interface (GUI) of our application by integrating JavaFX components. The new GUI not only enhances the overall user experience but also provides a more modern and intuitive look and feel. Additionally, we have updated the application's logic to seamlessly integrate the JavaFX components while ensuring that the core functionality of the chatbot remains intact. This means that users can continue to interact with the chatbot as they did before, with all existing features and capabilities fully preserved.

commitResults.messageBody:
Added assertions in some key places.

Ensures that important assumptions hold at various points in the code.
Improved the overall general code quality of the project
Add assertions
Improve Code Quality

Provide in-App guidance to users.

Added command to help page for users to view commands.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Cleaned up code, introduced enums, and added switch cases
commitResults.messageBody:
In this commit, I have performed several code improvements to enhance readability and maintainability. The main changes include:

- Cleaned up the codebase by removing redundant and unused variables, functions, and comments.
- Introduced meaningful enums to replace magic numbers or string literals, improving code clarity and reducing the chance of errors.
- Added switch cases to handle different scenarios more efficiently and comprehensively.

These changes will make the codebase more organized and easier to understand, and they also lay the groundwork for future enhancements. The code now adheres to better coding standards and practices.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code for improved clarity and maintainability
commitResults.messageBody:
In this commit, I've cleaned up the codebase to enhance readability and maintainability. I applied the SLAP (Single Level of Abstraction Principle) to ensure that each function focuses on a single task, resulting in cleaner and more modular code. Additionally, I've aimed to reduce the length of functions to less than 30 lines wherever possible.

Changes made in this commit:
- Split complex functions into smaller, more focused ones.
- Renamed variables and functions to improve code clarity.
- Removed redundant comments and code.
- Ensured consistent code formatting and style.

These changes should make the codebase easier to understand, maintain, and extend in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refine GUI: Add Colored Background and Rounded Images
commitResults.messageBody:
In this commit, the GUI has been enhanced to provide a more visually appealing
user experience. The changes include:

- Added colored background for the chat messages to improve readability and
  visual separation between user and bot messages.

- Rounded the user and bot images to create a more polished and modern look,
  enhancing the overall aesthetic of the chat interface.

These changes improve the overall look and feel of the Brotherman chatbot, making
it more user-friendly and visually appealing.

#GUI #Design #UserExperience
